column4: hi,  with these apps like parallels or vmware (or something else),  is there a way to have my computer boot up with both XP AND Ubunto loaded automatically and toggle between them without me having to open a dialog box each time and start up the "2nd" OS everytime I boot up?
vmware run from a natic partation
yea you realy install both on the pc
and what happens during boot up, both OS's get loaded at the same time ?
vmware can then boot lets say the xp partation from linux your using both your real installs vs a image
well once 1 has started you can run the other
yea you would have full aces to your real xp system
using vmware you have that abilty
it can start a real installed system
you can make vm do it
are you saying vmware can fork at a kernel level
that url is only about dual booting or running the OS in a VM
